question: Memory T cells can be identified by using the following marker:
exp: CD 45 is called as Leukocyte common antigen (LCA) Location of cell Molecular marker All leucocytes CD45 and CD45. RB Medullary thymocytes ('Naive' T- cells) CD45 RA and CD45. RC Coical thymocytes (Memory T-cells) CD45. RO

question: Which of the following cytokines are not secreted by Th2 type of helper T-cells?
exp: Th2 type of helper T-cells Secrete IL-4, IL-5, IL-13 IL-4 stimulate Th2 cells Th2 cells in turn cause stimulation of IgE production, activation of mast cells and eosinophils Mainly involved in allergies and defense against helminthic infestations

question: Toll like receptors, recognize bacterial products and stimulates immune response by:
exp: Toll-like receptors They are membrane proteins that recognize a variety of microbe-derived molecules and stimulate innate immune responses against the microbes. These derive there name due to homology to a Drosophila protein called 'Toll'. The Toll-like receptors are expressed on many immune cells of the body. Signaling by Toll-like receptors results in the activation of transcription factors, notably NF-kB and AP-1.
opc: Transcription of nuclear factor mediated by NF-kB which recruits cytokines

question: MHC class III genes encode:
exp: HLA class III contains genes for Complement components C2 and C4Q of classical pathway (Not C3Q) Properdin factor BQ of alternate pathway Tumor necrosis factorQ: Alpha and Beta Heat shock protein 70 Q Enzyme tyrosine hydroxylase Genes for MHC (also known as HLA) are located on sho arm of chromosome 6.

question: Cell type that lacks HLA antigen is:
exp: Class I MHC is expressed on all nucleated cells and platelets Class II MHC is expressed on APCs (macrophages, monocytes and dendritic cells), B- cells, Endothelial cells, and fibroblasts.
